thread.title: Arkansas agency makes change with health exchange shift
thread.title_full: Arkansas agency makes change with health exchange shift

title: Arkansas agency makes change with health exchange shift
text:
Arkansas Insurance Department makes change as health exchanges shift to state control 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 7/2/15 4:31   4:35 pm EDT 
LITTLE ROCK, Arkansas â€” A shift in governance over the state's health insurance exchanges has prompted the Arkansas Insurance Department to dissolve one oversight division and create another one. 
The Arkansas Democrat-Gazette ( http://bit.ly/1H3ZHtk ) reports that the move is part of a plan to establish state-run exchanges that are replacing those set up by the federal government under a partnership with the state. 
Legislation passed by lawmakers in 2013 created the Arkansas Health Insurance Marketplace and authorized it to assume responsibility of the state's insurance exchanges on Wednesday. To aid in the transition, the Arkansas Insurance Department eliminated its Health Connector Division and replaced it with the Regulatory Health Link Division. 
The department says the new division will provide regulation and guidance of federal health insurance market reforms. 
Information from: Arkansas Democrat-Gazette, http://www.arkansasonline.com
